sentence: Consumer shares were generally mixed ahead of the opening bell Monday.

J.C. Penney Co. ( JCP ) shares soared 7.6% pre-market after the retailer said it has appointed Marvin Ellison, currently executive vice president of stores at Home Depot ( HD ), as president and CEO-Designee, effective Nov. 1, 2014.
Ellison will also join the board.
He will succeed Myron E. (Mike) Ullman, III as CEO of on Aug. 1, 2015.
At that time, Ullman will become executive chairman of the board for one year.
ALCO Stores ( ALCS ) shares tumbled more than 33% after it filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy on Sunday.
ALCS plans to liquidate or sell the 113-year-old retail operation.

Lithia Motors ( LAD ) shares declined more than 9% in Monday's pre-market session, after the operator of automotive franchises and retailer of vehicles preliminarily reported Q3 adjusted earnings per share below its prior guidance as well as Street expectations, and forecast EPS for Q4, 2014 and 2015 below analysts' views.
LAD was trading in a 52-week range of $53.57 to $97.20.
